answerText: Sinbad the Sailor[10] The stories of Sinbad the Sailor are recounted by Scheherezade to this king to delay his execution of her.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Rutgers and Virginia A | 15 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This character refuses to eat a magic plant that turns his crewmates witless, and blinds a man-eating giant that had trapped him, in two stories suspiciously similar to the Odyssey. For 10 points each: [10] Name this legendary sailor, who goes on seven voyages recounted in the Arabian Nights.
